guide.introduction: Make a mouse for your computer that uses only an Arduino, an accelerometer, and your head movement to move and click.
guide.introduction_rendered:
Make a mouse for your computer that uses only an Arduino, an accelerometer, and your head movement to move and click.

Relevant parts
  • Arduino Leonardo
  • Micro USB Cable
  • Accelerometer, Memsic MX2125
  • Small Breadboard
  • Jumper Wire
  • Elastic band
  • Head Sweat Band
  • Tape, duct
  • Velcro Strip
  • Cardboard Rectangle
Tools
  • Sewing machine
  • basic sewing tools

parts.notes: Both sides of the velcro required

lines.text: The first step is to fabricate the hardware.
lines.text_raw: The first step is to fabricate the hardware.

lines.text: First, sew the 1.5-inch elastic band to the inside of the headband as in the first picture. The elastic band should be perpendicular to the headband.
lines.text_raw: First, sew the 1.5-inch elastic band to the inside of the headband as in the first picture. The elastic band should be perpendicular to the headband.

lines.text: Now, put the band on your head with the elastic strip over the top. It is imperative that you note where the elastic band intercepts the headband in the back.
lines.text_raw: Now, put the band on your head with the elastic strip over the top. It is imperative that you note where the elastic band intercepts the headband in the back.

lines.text: If there is more elastic band than necessary in the back, cut the extra off. Then sew two 1.5-inch "loop" velcro strips on to the end of the elastic band.
lines.text_raw: If there is more elastic band than necessary in the back, cut the extra off. Then sew two 1.5-inch "loop" velcro strips on to the end of the elastic band.

lines.text: Finally, sew three 2-inch "hook" velcro pieces onto the headband where the elastic band intersects with it (as in the third picture).
lines.text_raw: Finally, sew three 2-inch "hook" velcro pieces onto the headband where the elastic band intersects with it (as in the third picture).

lines.text: Make sure the finished headband looks like the first picture when it is fastened in the back. Then start the board assembly.
lines.text_raw: Make sure the finished headband looks like the first picture when it is fastened in the back. Then start the board assembly.

lines.text: First, use gorilla tape to secure the breadboard and the Arduino to the cardboard rectangle (they should fit perfectly side by side).
lines.text_raw: First, use gorilla tape to secure the breadboard and the Arduino to the cardboard rectangle (they should fit perfectly side by side).

lines.text: Wire +5v to the first column on the breadboard (the + column) and the GND pin to the second column (- column).
lines.text_raw: Wire +5v to the first column on the breadboard (the + column) and the GND pin to the second column (- column).

lines.text: Wire the two sets of +/- columns together (as in the second picture; the long blue and orange wires at the top).
lines.text_raw: Wire the two sets of +/- columns together (as in the second picture; the long blue and orange wires at the top).

lines.text: Place the accelerometer across the gap in the breadboard as in the third picture. You will notice that there is a little arrow on the accelerometer. Place the accelerometer such that this arrow is pointed away from the long black and orange wires in the Fritzing image.
lines.text_raw: Place the accelerometer across the gap in the breadboard as in the third picture. You will notice that there is a little arrow on the accelerometer. Place the accelerometer such that this arrow is pointed away from the long black and orange wires in the Fritzing image.

lines.text: To finish the wiring, start with the right side of the accelerometer, the rectangle side (per the diagram).
lines.text_raw: To finish the wiring, start with the right side of the accelerometer, the rectangle side (per the diagram).

lines.text: Wire the top pin to +5v, the middle pin to Arduino pin 2, and the bottom pin to GND.
lines.text_raw: Wire the top pin to +5v, the middle pin to Arduino pin 2, and the bottom pin to GND.

lines.text: On the left side (the circle side), ignore the top pin, wire the middle pin to Arduino pin 3, and the bottom pin to GND.
lines.text_raw: On the left side (the circle side), ignore the top pin, wire the middle pin to Arduino pin 3, and the bottom pin to GND.

lines.text: Now it is time to put the two parts together.
lines.text_raw: Now it is time to put the two parts together.

lines.text: Tape the cardboard square with the wiring on it to the elastic strip about 1 inch away from the headband, as the second picture shows.
lines.text_raw: Tape the cardboard square with the wiring on it to the elastic strip about 1 inch away from the headband, as the second picture shows.

lines.text: The front is the part that is sewn, and the back is the part that is attached by velcro.
lines.text_raw: The front is the part that is sewn, and the back is the part that is attached by velcro.

lines.text: Note: the headband used in this tutorial is not a sweatband, it is part of a hat (hence the velcro part that adjusts its size).
lines.text_raw: Note: the headband used in this tutorial is not a sweatband, it is part of a hat (hence the velcro part that adjusts its size).

lines.text: The last step is to import the code into the Arduino, and run the program.
lines.text_raw: The last step is to import the code into the Arduino, and run the program.

lines.text: The code can be found here.
lines.text_raw: The code can be found [http://code.google.com/p/arduino-accelerometer-mouse/wiki/FinalCode?ts=1354559033&updated=FinalCode|here].

lines.text: Please note the first comment in the comments section of the page; it has valuable information.
lines.text_raw: Please note the first comment in the comments section of the page; it has valuable information.

lines.text: Upload this code to your Arduino with the Arduino IDE (download link) using the Micro USB cable.
lines.text_raw: Upload this code to your Arduino with the Arduino IDE ([http://arduino.cc/en/Main/Software|download link]) using the Micro USB cable.

lines.text: Keeping the cable connected to your computer, put the band on your head and velcro the elastic band in place.
lines.text_raw: Keeping the cable connected to your computer, put the band on your head and velcro the elastic band in place.

lines.text: Yay. You are all done. Congratz!
lines.text_raw: Yay. You are all done. Congratz!
